meanings.definition: To build up again from parts; reconstruct.
meanings.sent1: I will reconstitute the broken toy by putting its pieces back together.
meanings.sent2: The scientist had to reconstitute the experiment after it failed.
meanings.sent3: Trying to reconstitute a jigsaw puzzle blindfolded is quite a challenge.
meanings.sent4: She managed to reconstitute her shattered confidence after the setback.
meanings.sent5: The artist's goal was to reconstitute the beauty of the landscape in her painting.

meanings.definition: To return to a previous state by adding water.
meanings.sent1: To make the soup, simply reconstitute the dried mix with hot water.
meanings.sent2: The dehydrated food will reconstitute when you add water to it.
meanings.sent3: He tried to reconstitute the dried fruit, but it ended up too soggy.
meanings.sent4: The desert landscape seemed to reconstitute itself after a heavy rain.
meanings.sent5: The flowers will reconstitute once you water them properly.

meanings.definition: To restore to a former state by adding liquid.
meanings.sent1: You can reconstitute the concentrated juice by adding water.
meanings.sent2: The chef needed to reconstitute the sauce to its original consistency.
meanings.sent3: The wizard's spell accidentally reconstituted the potion into a jelly-like substance.
meanings.sent4: The rain helped reconstitute the dried-up river back to its full flow.
meanings.sent5: Adding milk will reconstitute the powdered drink into a creamy beverage.
